sections.heading: What is Present Tense in Japanese?
sections.content:
Japanese "present tense" is actually a non-past tense that covers both present and future meanings. It's used for current states, habitual actions, general truths, and future events.

食べる "eat / will eat" 学生です "am a student" 雨が降る "it rains / it will rain"

children.heading: Plain Form (Dictionary Form)
children.content: 食べる - eat 行く - go 見る - see する - do

children.heading: Polite Form (ます Form)
children.content: 食べます - eat (polite) 行きます - go (polite) 見ます - see (polite) します - do (polite)

children.heading: 1. Current State/Condition
children.content:
Describing how things are right now:

私は学生です "I am a student" 今日は暑い "Today is hot" ここは静かです "Here is quiet" 彼は忙しい "He is busy"

children.heading: 2. Habitual/Regular Actions
children.content:
Actions that happen regularly:

毎日学校に行く "I go to school every day" 朝ごはんを食べます "I eat breakfast" よく本を読む "I often read books" 週末は休みます "I rest on weekends"

children.heading: 3. General Truths/Facts
children.content:
Universal or permanent truths:

太陽は東から昇る "The sun rises from the east" 水は100度で沸騰する "Water boils at 100 degrees" 地球は丸い "The Earth is round" 猫は動物です "Cats are animals"

children.heading: 4. Future Events
children.content:
Present tense can express future actions:

明日東京に行く "I will go to Tokyo tomorrow" 来週テストがある "There will be a test next week" 8時に会います "I will meet (you) at 8 o'clock" 来年日本に来る "I will come to Japan next year"

children.heading: 5. Scheduled Events
children.content:
Fixed schedules and timetables:

電車は9時に出発する "The train departs at 9 o'clock" 授業は月曜日に始まる "Class starts on Monday" 店は10時に開く "The store opens at 10 o'clock"

sections.heading: Present Progressive: 〜ている
sections.content:
For actions happening RIGHT NOW, use ている:

今、勉強している "I'm studying now" 雨が降っている "It is raining" テレビを見ています "I'm watching TV"

children.heading: Present Tense vs ている
children.content: Present simple: 本を読む "I read books" (habitual) Present progressive: 本を読んでいる "I'm reading a book" (right now)

children.heading: Present/Habitual
children.content: 毎日 - every day いつも - always よく - often 時々 - sometimes 毎日運動する "I exercise every day" いつも早く起きます "I always wake up early"

children.heading: Future
children.content: 明日 - tomorrow 来週 - next week 今晩 - tonight 後で - later 明日映画を見る "I will watch a movie tomorrow" 来週テストがあります "There will be a test next week"

children.heading: Plain Negative
children.content: 食べる → 食べない "don't eat / won't eat" 行く → 行かない "don't go / won't go" する → しない "don't do / won't do"

children.heading: Polite Negative
children.content: 食べます → 食べません "don't eat / won't eat" 行きます → 行きません "don't go / won't go" します → しません "don't do / won't do"

children.heading: Yes/No Questions
children.content: 食べますか？ "Do you eat? / Will you eat?" 学生ですか？ "Are you a student?" 行きますか？ "Do you go? / Will you go?"

children.heading: With Question Words
children.content: 何を食べますか？ "What do you eat?" いつ行きますか？ "When do you go?" どこに住んでいますか？ "Where do you live?"

children.heading: Example 1: Daily Routine
children.content: A: 毎朝何時に起きますか？ "What time do you wake up every morning?" B: 7時に起きます "I wake up at 7 o'clock" A: 朝ごはんは食べますか？ "Do you eat breakfast?" B: はい、いつも食べます "Yes, I always eat it"

children.heading: Example 2: Future Plans
children.content: A: 明日何をしますか？ "What will you do tomorrow?" B: 映画を見に行きます "I will go to see a movie" A: 何時に行きますか？ "What time will you go?" B: 3時に行きます "I will go at 3 o'clock"

children.heading: Example 3: General Information
children.content: A: どこに住んでいますか？ "Where do you live?" B: 東京に住んでいます "I live in Tokyo" A: 仕事は何ですか？ "What's your job?" B: 会社員です "I'm a company employee"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Using present for ongoing actions
children.content: Wrong context (happening now): 今、勉強する ⚠️ Better: 今、勉強している ✓ "I'm studying now" Note: 勉強する can mean "I study" (habitual) or "I will study"

children.heading: Mistake 2: Confusing with past tense
children.content: Wrong: 昨日食べる ❌ Right: 昨日食べた ✓ "I ate yesterday"

children.heading: Mistake 3: Forgetting です with nouns
children.content: Wrong: 私は学生 ⚠️ (incomplete) Right: 私は学生です ✓ "I am a student"

sections.heading: Present Tense with Different Word Types

children.heading: Verbs
children.content: 食べる / 食べます "eat / will eat" 行く / 行きます "go / will go" 見る / 見ます "see / will see"

children.heading: I-adjectives
children.content: 高い / 高いです "is expensive" 楽しい / 楽しいです "is fun" 大きい / 大きいです "is big"

children.heading: Na-adjectives
children.content: 便利だ / 便利です "is convenient" 静かだ / 静かです "is quiet" 元気だ / 元気です "is healthy/energetic"

children.heading: Nouns + Copula
children.content: 学生だ / 学生です "is a student" 先生だ / 先生です "is a teacher" 日本人だ / 日本人です "is Japanese"

children.heading: Definite Plans
children.content: 明日東京に行く "I will go to Tokyo tomorrow" 来週友達が来る "My friend will come next week" 今晩パーティーがある "There will be a party tonight"

children.heading: Scheduled Events
children.content: 授業は9時に始まる "Class starts at 9 o'clock" 電車は10分後に出発する "The train departs in 10 minutes"

children.heading: Adding つもり for Intention
children.content: 来年日本に行くつもりだ "I intend to go to Japan next year" 大学で勉強するつもりです "I intend to study at university"

sections.heading: Contextual Understanding
sections.content:
Context determines whether present tense means "now" or "future":

明日雨が降る "It will rain tomorrow" (future - 明日) 毎日雨が降る "It rains every day" (habitual - 毎日) 今雨が降っている "It is raining now" (current - ている)

children.heading: Casual Settings
children.content: 行く "go / will go" 食べる "eat / will eat"

children.heading: Polite Settings
children.content: 行きます "go / will go" 食べます "eat / will eat"

children.heading: ある and いる (Existence)
children.content: ここに本がある "There is a book here" 誰かいる "Someone is there"

children.heading: できる (Can/Ability)
children.content: 日本語ができる "I can speak Japanese" 泳ぐことができます "I can swim"

children.heading: Current State
children.content: 今日は暑い "Today is hot" 私は学生です "I am a student" ここは静かです "Here is quiet" 彼は忙しい "He is busy"

children.heading: Habitual Actions
children.content: 毎日学校に行く "I go to school every day" 朝ごはんを食べます "I eat breakfast" よく本を読む "I often read books" いつも早く起きます "I always wake up early"

children.heading: Future Events
children.content: 明日東京に行く "I will go to Tokyo tomorrow" 来週テストがあります "There will be a test next week" 今晩映画を見る "I will watch a movie tonight"

children.heading: General Truths
children.content: 太陽は東から昇る "The sun rises from the east" 水は0度で凍る "Water freezes at 0 degrees" 猫は動物です "Cats are animals"

children.heading: Questions
children.content: 何を食べますか？ "What do you eat?" いつ行きますか？ "When will you go?" どこに住んでいますか？ "Where do you live?" 毎日運動しますか？ "Do you exercise every day?"
